# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variables is the following:

* Short name: `cont_rel`
* Variable label: `Are any form of contact ( face-to-face/phone/mail/Internet communicators) with family members/relatives frequent (i.e. contact once a week or more often)?`
* Domain: `Social environment`
* Value type: `cathegorical`
* Categories:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | No
1        | Yes


* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

# Data process

## Cuba
### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variables

The study-specific variable elected to be harmonised is:

* Name: `PRELFRQ`
* Label: `frequency of seeing relatives`
* Categories: 
    + `0 = never`
    + `1 = daily`
    + `2 = 2-3 times/ week`
    + `3 = at least weekly`	
    + `4 = at least monthly`
    + `5 = less often`


* Description: 
```{r assign1 cuba}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_cuba_w1_cont_rel','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline',variables=list('PRELFRQ'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local1 cuba}
t1066_cuba_w1_cont_rel <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_cuba_w1_cont_rel')
vari <- t1066_cuba_w1_cont_rel$PRELFRQ
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = attributes(vari)$`spss::shortName`)
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
#Categorical_summary(var = t1066_cuba_w1_cont_rel$PRELFRQ, missing_values = NA)
ggplot(t1066_cuba_w1_cont_rel, aes(x=factor(PRELFRQ))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("frequency of seeing relatives") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PRELFRQ in (0,5) into 0`
* `PRELFRQ in (1,2,3,4) into 1`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo1 cuba, echo=TRUE}
t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w1_cont_rel$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cont_rel <- car::recode(as.vector(t1066_cuba_w1_cont_rel$PRELFRQ), "0='0'; 5='0'; 1:4='1'; NA='999'")
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cont_rel <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cont_rel, labels = c("No"=0, "Yes"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Don't answer"=995,  "Not attempt/not done/not yet recorded"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI/interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript1 cuba}
vari <-t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cont_rel
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3]) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
#Categorical_summary(var = t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cont_rel, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(cont_rel))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Are the contacts with family members/relatives frequent") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation1 cuba}
AfterH <- table(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cont_rel)
BeforeH <- table(t1066_cuba_w1_cont_rel$PRELFRQ, useNA='ifany')
BeforeH[[2]] <- sum(BeforeH[c(2:(length(BeforeH)-2))])
BeforeH[[1]] <- sum(BeforeH[c(1,(length(BeforeH)-1))])
BeforeH <- BeforeH[c(1,2,length(BeforeH))]
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("0","1","NA->999")
kable(C)
```

#### Study-specific variables

The study-specific variable elected to be harmonised is:

* Name: `PRELFRQ`
* Label: `frequency of seeing relatives`
* Categories: 
    + `0 = never`
    + `1 = daily`
    + `2 = 2-3 times/ week`
    + `3 = at least weekly`	
    + `4 = at least monthly`
    + `5 = less often`


* Description: 
```{r assign1 Ven}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_Ven_w1_cont_rel','10-66.1066-Venezuela-Baseline',variables=list('PRELFRQ'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local1 Ven}
t1066_Ven_w1_cont_rel <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_Ven_w1_cont_rel')
vari <- t1066_Ven_w1_cont_rel$PRELFRQ
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = attributes(vari)$`spss::shortName`)
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
#Categorical_summary(var = t1066_Ven_w1_cont_rel$PRELFRQ, missing_values = NA)

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PRELFRQ in (0,5) into 0`
* `PRELFRQ in (1,2,3,4) into 1`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo1 Ven, echo=TRUE}
t1066_ds_Ven_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_Ven_w1_cont_rel$id)
t1066_ds_Ven_w1$cont_rel <- car::recode(as.vector(t1066_Ven_w1_cont_rel$PRELFRQ), "0='0'; 5='0'; 1:4='1'; NA='999'")
t1066_ds_Ven_w1$cont_rel <- labelled(t1066_ds_Ven_w1$cont_rel, labels = c("No"=0, "Yes"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Don't answer"=995,  "Not attempt/not done/not yet recorded"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI/interviewer error"=991))
```
